intro: Utricularia exilis var. elatior, commonly known as the slender bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing prey. This variant is typically found in shallow, nutrient-poor aquatic environments such as ponds and wetlands. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with floating stems and rooted shoots, allowing it to thrive in both submerged and emergent habitats. Its ability to trap small aquatic organisms makes it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
